item.title: Trump 'not thrilled' with Iran after latest talks on nuclear programme
item.summary: President Trump said he was not happy with Iran's stance, but had not yet decided whether to attack.

item.title: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
item.summary: This is the highest number of confirmed casualties from a single African country in the Ukraine-Russia war.

item.title: India and Israel pledge to boost ties in defence and technology
item.summary: Opposition parties have criticised Modi's visit and accused the government of abandoning the Palestinian cause.

item.title: Indian court clears former Delhi chief minister of corruption charges
item.summary: Arvind Kejriwal was arrested in March 2024, weeks before India's general election, and spent months in jail.

item.title: Pakistan defence minister says country in 'open war' with Afghanistan after strikes
item.summary: The latest attacks by Pakistan follow months of clashes between the two countries. despite agreeing to a fragile ceasefire in October.

item.title: Paramount set for $111bn Warner Bros takeover after Netflix drops bid
item.summary: Netflix's decision to back down from the bidding war clears the path for Paramount to win the takeover battle.

item.title: 'Obnoxious' AI chatbot talked about its mother, customers say
item.summary: Australian supermarket giant Woolworths tweaks its AI-powered assistant after users said it gave them the "ick".

item.title: Tram derails in Milan, leaving two dead and dozens injured
item.summary: The crowded tram was travelling in the centre of Milan at rush hour when it appeared to crash into the side of a building.

item.title: What we know after latest escalation in Pakistan-Afghanistan tensions
item.summary: Bombings by Pakistan are the most significant development in tensions between the two neighbours - though the physical impact remains unclear.

item.title: Drone jammed near French aircraft carrier was Russian, says Sweden
item.summary: Sweden's prime minister said it was a serious but not unexpected incident - and a "Russian way of acting that we recognise from other places".
